metadata.title: CVE-2024-25741 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
printer_write in drivers/usb/gadget/function/f_printer.c in the Linuxkernel through 6.7.4 does not properly call usb_ep_queue, which might allowattackers to cause a denial of service or have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
